name: Thermochromic Lizard
desc: A cute creature that spends most of its time on the hot surfaces of the engine room, changing color depending on the temperature. Some mechanics seem to trust these lizards more than the ship's monitoring systems. They are considered extremely friendly and easy to keep, owing mostly to the fact that they are too lazy to move when approached. They can apparently survive in active plasma chambers.
natural_death: moved to a warmer spot in the engine fuel conduit.

name: Plasma Snake
desc: These are long, slender creatures that emit a glowing plasma field around their skin. They are popular for their striking appearance and ability to produce light in dark environments, and make for great makeshift weapons in a pinch, but have to be kept in faraday cages lest they interfere with the sensitive systems aboard a ship.
natural_death: gave out under the constant fluctuations of the ships charge fields.

name: Mechiders
desc: These are tiny spider-like utility drones that can crawl over almost any surface and are usually used for various maintenance tasks on a starship. They are highly customizable and can be programmed to perform anything from cleaning to surveillance. Most people find them repulsive, but there's always that weirdo crewman that loves em. Any capital ship worth their name has an illegal fighting club for modded ones.
natural_death: got too damaged in an arena fight and was beyond saving.

name: Tammy
desc: Tri-Tachyon Alchemical Moss, affectionately called "Tammy" by most spacers, is the result of a cross-department shipping error within a Tri-Tachyon blacksite. Combining both organic and nanotechnology, it is neither plant nor bot, but definitely semi-sentient. It tends to use its pot as torso, forming roots to walk around with, and likes playing pranks with the electrical grid. The former employee that saved it from the incinerator is called a hero by most crewmen, and considered an evil witch by maintenance technicians.
natural_death: accidentally electrocuted itself and shut down.

name: Bluejacket Hive
desc: While not exactly a living thing, this Tri-Tachyon Drone Hive produces shared conciousness delta level AI swarms to serve as messengers and companions. They can even form some simple games! All Bluejacket hives can network and usually interface with each other when close enough, allowing for covert information gathering - that is, were they not three decades out of date with easily spoofed security codes. They eat credstics for sustenance.
natural_death: bricked itself due to a failed software update. Circle of life, and all.

name: Clockwork Fairy
desc: Crafted through a sponsored research project at Galatia Academy, the Clockwork Fairy is a mesmerizing creation of intricate clockwork and advanced technology. This enchanting mechanical creature, beloved by children and fairy tale enthusiasts alike, buzzes about with mischievous charm while indulging in playful misdemeanors such as petty theft and tax evasion. Its whimsical presence captivates hearts and evokes joy, while pirates, for reasons unknown, harbor an inherent dislike for it.
natural_death: fell apart in mid-air and remains motionless.

name: Bugdog
desc: An odd creature with no known origin, mostly known for its perpetually displeased face and tendency to grow long and fancy eyebrows when stressed. Beauty pageants for bugdogs with fashionably styled facial hair were established shortly after their discovery, only to be ruled inhumane when multiple dedicated stress-shops were uncovered. Bugdogs are notorious for causing electronic malfunctions around them, leaving a trail of broken devices and frustrated owners in their wake. Their disdainful snorts and grumbles are considered endearing by a small subset of slightly deranged spacers.
natural_death: died of stress.

name: Space Dog
desc: A simple dog from a breed accustomed to the variable gravity of ships and the sudden change in orientation that can occur in gravity wells. It is still the best friend of many a crew, even if there are some minor technical difficulties in taking it out for a walk.
natural_death: passed on in peace.

name: Spirit Fox
desc: Considered ceremonial pets by the Luddic Church, these foxes are typically found with pilgrims journeying across the sector. Folklore tells of Ludds' Spirit watching the world through their eyes, taking in both sin and suffering, then absolving the traveller of their vices when the journey is complete - to thank them for sights seen and unseen. Spirit Foxes are friendly and playful, but require more maintenance than other animals.
natural_death: returned to Ludds eternal embrace.

name: Hamster
desc: It's a hamster. Hates artificial gravity. Tends to die within a month.
natural_death: HAMSTER_CAUSE_OF_DEATH

name: Grav-Cat
desc: These are genetically-engineered cats with an almost surreal ability to stick to a surface. They can walk on walls and ceilings and are often used as playful companions by spacers on long missions. Many a gunner has missed a shot due to sudden ceiling-borne airdrops by grav cats, but who can blame em?
natural_death: now happily hunts grav-mice on ludds endless farm.

name: Phase Cat
desc: These are sleek, black cats with glowing eyes that are able to enter phase for a few seconds at a time, causing untold chaos wherever they happen to wander - which usually entails moving straight through a wall. They are often seen as good luck charms by space-faring crews, thought to be protecting them against horrors from the abyss, and some even believe that they can see into the future.
natural_death: went on, to stand strong in the eternal defence of the living.

name: Space Rat
desc: These are small, furry rodents that are often kept as pets on space stations and ships. They are low-maintenance and can survive in almost any environment, making them a popular choice among spacers - and food, if the situation is desperate enough. Colour and fur pattern is fully customizeable.
natural_death: was discovered lifeless in its habitat.

name: Lunar Rat
desc: A rather rare rodent with white to yellow coloration that can float above the ground for a few seconds at a time. Loves round objects and will try to chase them, often jumping towards lightbulbs or windows in an attempt to reach them. Lunar Rats need very little air and can survive in near-vacuum for a surprisingly long time.
natural_death: went to live on the cheese moon for eternity.

name: Qaras Leopard
desc: A result of unsanctioned, haphazard genemodding of an old earth snow leaopard, this giant cat has a beautiful, gleaming white coat of silklike fur. They are agressive, stupid and have convoluted dietary and habitation requirements, are kept mostly by megalomaniac rogue captains, and tend to die early. Nonetheless, they are prized far beyond their value as a testament to Pirate prowess and ingenuity.
natural_death: ran against a wall full force and died.

name: Void Sheep
desc: A rather elusive pet, the Void Sheep is known for its peculiar trait of ceasing to exist when not under constant observation. Clothing made from its wool holds tremendous value and is highly sought after due to its rarity. Complete, released sets are extremely difficult to come by, as they have a tendency to mysteriously vanish. Despite its unpredictable nature, the Void Sheep is undeniably fluffy and endearing, often surprising its owners with unexpected, playful antics.
natural_death: suddenly vanished and failed to reappear up until now.

name: Former Pirate Captain
desc: This unfortunate individual, formerly called Captain Perch, seems to have been the original owner of a certain cyberparrot-turned-pirate-lord. He displays signs of diminished responsiveness, excessive drooling, and emits peculiar, animalistic vocalizations, likely due to his crudely removed voice implants. While the exact details of his condition remain unclear, the scars he bears suggest an ill-fated attempt to hide crackers in his brain. Likes to eat soft buns, collecting pretty - if worthless - baubles, and cuddling up to the flux ducts.
natural_death: passed away while cuddled up to the heating vents.

name: Gigabee
desc: An insectoid resembling an old Terran bumblebee with both a friendly demeanor and an easy diet. There are two two major differences to their precursors: They are the size of a cat, and are not swarm animals, instead forming pack bonds with whoever happens to be around. Studies prove that they should not be able to fly with their wing-to-body ratio; the Gigabee does it anyway, and is all the more beloved for it.
natural_death: buzzed off to heaven.

name: Kumari Vapour Ray
desc: Resembling small stingrays, these majestic animals live in the upper, low pressure layers of Kumari Aru. They are filter feeders consuming microscopic wildlife similar to krill, and can easily be tamed with treats. Considered to make great shipborne pets owing to their docile nature and being accustomed to zero G environments.
natural_death: swam off towards the great dark beyond.

name: Jungle Shark
desc: A highly active predator native to Jangala. Although usually considered dangerous, some eccentrics capture and keep them as pets. Jungle Sharks are considered a delicacy in Persean League and Hegemony high societies, causing both their price and the amount of people risking their lives to capture one to rise sharply. They are very high maintenance and require frequent feeding.
natural_death: passed on to the great hunting grounds.

name: Huggerfish
desc: Discovered in the outskirts of the Sector during a routine scan of a pre-seeded water world, this weird creature evolved from a pufferfish but appears to have lost their signature spikes in the process. Initially adopted by depressed spacers looking for a laugh, their friendliness and their tendency to balloon when happy led to their unprecedented spread as pets amongst the stars.
natural_death: is now being hugged by a thousand children in the great beyond.

name: Imperial Megalobster
desc: A needy, cat-sized, vibrant magenta volturnian lobster created in an artificial breeding programme. Smarter than the average dog and quite social for a lobster, the first of these creatures are rumored to have been made for a slightly deranged patriach of a fuel conglomerate during the course of a bet. Considered to be one of the natural heritages of Volturn, their owners are tracked and deaths are investigated by a dedicated company subdivision.
natural_death: was found lifeless. The investigation bureau sent a strongly worded letter, but did not take further action.

name: Agravifish
desc: Their name is a shortened version of "anti-gravity jellyfish". Found only in advanced space habitats or kept by exceedingly rich captains, they are admired for their otherworldly beauty and their ability to float effortlessly in mid-air. They use their long, delicate tentacles to grasp onto objects or unsuspecting spacers' heads. Keeping antitoxins on hand is generally recommended.
natural_death: floated off towards the next cycle of life.

name: Mazalotian Goldfish
desc: These are brightly-colored, tropical fish that are native to the signature waterworld of the Persean League. They are popular among space travelers who keep them in small aquariums for their beauty, though they do tend to die quickly when not fed properly. Their name has become a synonym for the aristocracy, who hate the term with a passion.
natural_death: did not get fed for a single day and died.

name: Profane Crustacean
desc: What happens when a bunch of bored soldiers get their hands on a mobile genetic editing kit? A swearing crab. Literally. Through the power of severe overestimation of ability, these crustaceans have been imbued with both the capacity to mimic human language and a massive dictionary of profanities. Most people act as if they were not funny. Their wide spread speaks other words. Mostly swear words.
natural_death: GOT FUCKED YOU BLOODY ASS CUNT BUY ANOTHER ONE

name: Cyberparrot
desc: These colorful and viciously smart parrots have been enhanced with cybernetic implants, giving them an intellect often surpassing their owners. They are popular among tech enthusiasts and often used as companions by space engineers and mechanics, to serve as both pet and assistant. There is a popular story about a captain that lost in a mutiny against his Cyberparrot, who then went on to have a successful career as pirate lord.
natural_death: now tinkers on in hyper-heaven.

name: Salvage Raven
desc: Descended from ancient terran birds, these keen, jet-black feathered troublemakers have an insatiable thirst for shiny objects. Untamed specimen are the bane of any mechanic, but properly trained ones are able to sort and categorize salvage and tools with surprising accuracy, making cleanup operations significantly faster - even if some pieces tend to go missing every now and then. Nicknamed "The Engineers' Second Best Friend.". First place goes to the hammer, since time immemorial.
natural_death: went on to steal trinkets from Ludd.

name: Hull Chicken
desc: Hull Chickens got named after their tendency to nest in armor bulkheads. They evolved to scavenge for iron scraps and other metal debris to supplement their diet, creating eggs with hard metal shells that survive floating in Zero-G and protect against the impact that happens when the grav generators kick in again. Their small size and low resource requirements also make them an ideal and surprisingly affectionate pet for those living in cramped quarters.
natural_death: now nests in the great beyond.

name: Slag Hound
foodCommodities: IndEvo_pet_food, ore, rare_ore, metals, rare_metals, IndEvo_parts, heavy_machinery
desc: What appears to be a mobile pile of rocks is actually a sentient animal of lazy and docile nature. Their extremely high internal temperature and diet of coal, ores and metal gave them their name and made them ideal companions to both scavs and salvagers, who keep them as moving waste disposals. Slag hounds never stop growing and are considered functionally immortal - which causes many to become involuntary asteroids when their habitat amongst the stars meets an untimely end.
natural_death: became too large to fit into even the largest bay and had to be ejected from the ship. It was given its favorite alloys and lots of pets before the departure. Its trajectory will have it land on a metal-rich planet in due time.

name: Goo Puppy
desc: These are small, amorphous creatures that like forming into entities reminiscent of young dogs. They are playful and affectionate, and can mold themselves into different shapes and sizes. They also eat anything, including spare electronics and body parts, and usually have a permanent employment in the mess hall.
natural_death: became unstable due to old age and dissipated in its sleep. The ship crew held a wake and served jelly shots.

name: Astral Squid
desc: Small packs of fighter sized, spaceborne animals with an uncanny resemblance to regular earth squids, these creatures hunt via ambush tactics and scavenge in the upper atmosphere of planets. Exceptionally intelligent to the point many consider them smarter than your average marine, they can be trained to retrieve lost crew from space in exchange for food. Comsec actively denies rumors of the Astral Kraken, causing spacers to collectively accept the myth as truth.
natural_death: departed from your fleet into deep space to die in peace. It left a pile of unidentified meat as departure gift. You held a feast to remember it by, and only a few crewmembers got sick afterwards.

name: Ashen Cat
desc: Looking like a black-and-grey cat, these creatures are the result of a nanite host attaching itself to a common house cat like a viral disease. They shed dead nanites wherever they go, earning themselsves their name and making them a nuisance to filter repairmen everywhere. Considered uncommon, they tend to live longer than their counterparts due to the nanites gradually replacing their biological bodies.
natural_death: dissolved into ash after losing their last natural pieces to the nanite disease.

name: Blobfish
desc: Blobfish have nothing to do with their old-earth counterparts. They are a weird, lab-made, landborne animal of the probably-a-fish variety who inflate when threatened, not threatened, hungry or bored, getting bigger each time. Since they lose elasticity when ageing, they tend to look like old saggy bags after a while. Most common cause of death: a child with a needle.
natural_death: turned into a balloon and was popped. This does not come as a surprise to anyone.

name: Lord Foog the 2st
desc: The full species name is actually His Majesty Grand Protector Lord Foog the 2st, Regent Theoretical. Bred from an ancient Borzoi line, only three exist at any time - 1st, 2st, and 3st - to keep the population stable and properly inbred. These dogs have psychic powers, strength depending on nose length, and are incredibly good at aiming down iron sights, making them a credible threat in combat. Lord Foog Borzoi are the only animals that may own land according to Persean League regulations, and have extensive assets all over Mazalot.
natural_death: passed away due to old age. A state funeral was held and they will be interred in the family crypt after the mandatory mourning period has finished.
